events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and another car on Main Street, resulting in moderate damage to their front bumper.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the provided details regarding the car collision incident.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to handle the claim and reach out to the customer regarding next steps.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that the investigation would begin shortly.
Additional documents including photos of the damaged vehicle and a police report were requested to support the claim investigation.
The customer submitted all required documents, including detailed images of the accident damage and the official police report.
The claim investigation started with an assessment of the accident circumstances and verification of the submitted documents.
The investigation concluded that the customer's vehicle sustained moderate damage and the other party was liable for the accident.
A settlement proposal was sent to the customer covering repair costs and providing a rental vehicle allowance during the repair period.
The customer responded positively, expressing appreciation for the timely communication and clarity regarding the settlement offer.
Following acceptance of the settlement by the customer, the claim was officially approved to proceed with payment.
The payment for the vehicle repairs and rental coverage was issued to the customer’s account promptly as agreed.
The claim was closed successfully after confirming the customer’s satisfaction with the settlement and payment received.
All records related to the claim were securely archived for future reference and compliance auditing purposes.
